p: Aerial parts of six populations of Salvia blancoana subsp. mariolensis, two of S. officinalis subsp. lavandulifolia, and one of S. x hegelmaieri, S. officinalis subsp. officinalis, S. x auriculata, and S. microphylla var. microphylla were collected during flowering stage in June-July 2010 in different localities from Valencia region (Spain). In addition, two more samples, one of S. blancoana subsp. mariolensis and another of S. officinalis subsp. lavandulifolia were collected in winter time, with the aim of detecting seasonal changes in their essential oil composition (Table 1, Figure 1). Plant material was air-dried at room temperature in a dark, dry place and later stored until used.
